alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 9:22PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Clay, northwestern Otter Tail, Wilkin, southeastern Cass and northeastern Richland Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 922 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Baker to near Abercrombie. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Barnesville around 930 PM CDT. Rollag around 935 PM CDT. Lawndale around 940 PM CDT. Everdell around 945 PM CDT. Foxhome and Pelican Rapids around 950 PM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 38 and 52. Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 14 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
